name: Public Speaking
notes:
"A voice magnificent and morose, lost in a world of single being in performance." - Experimental NYC

"He crafts coherent songs out of abstract processes and R&B from the tools of noise with the assured vision of an expert… a thrilling melange of found sound and pop music."
- Experimedia

"This is soul music functioning as 21st century meditation. Jason Anthony Harris has taken the defining objects of our modern age, and imported hidden meaning to their status. ...Public Speaking is what happens when an artist personally realizes the sound of his environment, and puts it to use. ...Experience the intimate soul croon of Public Speaking." - The Deli NYC

name: My Love MHz
notes: As the musical identity of digital artist Allan Pichardo, My Love MHz creates minimal electronic music that is as equally influenced by modern digital culture as it is by the Krautrock and Berlin-school electronic artists of the 70's. It is founded on the idea that even in the precise, cold, calculative world of computer music, tribal rhythms and emotions are undeniably emergent.

name: A Bunch of Dead People
notes: A Bunch of Dead People is the vehicle for the compositions of Ruben Sindo Acosta. The music is a blend of Krautrock, Soul, Funk, Afro-Cuban Santeria, Dance Music and (the ever so prevalent) Melodramatic Popular song. The band is also a cult with new members joining everyday. Mind Above All, Heart Above All Else.

name: Supplier
notes: Supplier is a mostly instrumental collective drawing from soul, progressive rock, and modern music.

name: Eternal Garb
notes: Eternal Garb is the solo project of multi-instrumentalist Zach Ryalls.

name: Wsabi Fox
notes:
Performative art prog of various incarnations by Pinay Brooklyn-based MF Boss, Jennae Santos. 

Strutting them but also thrashing around from time to time like nick cage in wild at heart.

name: Madam West
notes:
Madam West is an NYC-based experimental pop quintet. Originating as a synth-pop duo in a musty Bushwick basement, the group has grown into a five-piece fusing alt-rock, folk and neosoul influences into a layered and danceable sound wholly their own.

The group has been favorably reviewed in IMPOSE, Tiny Mix Tapes, GoldFlakePaint, NextNorthWest, and Bearded (UK) and embarked on their first national tour in Spring 2017. Madam West has opened for Anna Wise (Grammy winner for Kendrick Lamar’s To Pimp A Butterfly) and shared festival bills with artists the likes of Milo, Guerrilla Toss and Zola Jesus.

name: underorder
notes: this is the avant indie project of composer/multi-instrumentalist Gabriel Zucker.
